fields.System.Title: SPT - PricingService - Virtual Networking Consistency (LZ - Test env)
fields.System.Description:
Currently the new Test env is on the landing zone vnets whereas all the other environments were silo'd virtual networking meaning inconsistency in environment set up 
  • Discovery and stakeholder engagement
  • Runbook for remediation
  • Implementation and coordination with stakeholders

NOTE: As Production is included in the non-compliant environments this work would be a breaking change.
fields.System.History: If further work is required for this discovery, a new US will need to be created to link to AW25 CI Epic

fields.System.Title: SPT - FastTrack - API Security
fields.System.Description: Investigate outstanding issues when connecting to the FastTrack UI from an external network.
fields.System.History: Once APIM handover takes place we can include placing the API behind that gateway.

fields.System.Title: SPT - Migrate SPNs to Workload Identity
fields.System.Description:
Migrate to workload identity as this is MS best practice and will remove the need for an operational task to rotate the secret on the SPNs every 6 months.

Example: https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/Product.ICS/_git/ics-inf?version=GBmain&path=%2fterraform%2fservice_connections.tf
fields.System.History: Waiting for Core Platform team to offer a method that avoids any use of PAT tokens.

fields.System.Title: SPT - ZEOS - Event Grid Topic - StockPlanning
fields.System.Description: Task outputs from the ZEOS Plaform planning session for the Event Grid Topic that resides in SPT Shared Infrastructure. This topic accepts requests from the central Event Grid resources to be handled a Stock Planning Function App for ZEOS transactions.

fields.System.Reason: Moved out of state Ready for Development
fields.System.Title: SPT - ZEOS - Key Vault - StockPlanning
fields.System.Description: Task outputs from the ZEOS Plaform planning session for remaining tasks for Key Vault outstanding items Stock Planning infrastructure.

fields.System.Title: SPT - Domain Specific Application Gateway - SharedInfrastructure
fields.System.Description: The decision has been made by the cloud architect function to move away from the centralised Application Gateway resources and move to a decentralised model. This will allow for more granular control over the resources and reduce the blast radius of any issues. This task is to deploy and configure the Application Gateway resources for the SPT platform.
fields.System.History: @Poole, Mark will work towards developing a draft standards doc we can contribute to as a first step

fields.System.Title: APIM - Blazor Web Assembly API Protection
fields.System.Description:
The challenge we face is that the ideal position is for the API to only accept requests from the frontend application tier. However, since discovering that many SPT applications are Blazor Web Assembly for public consumption, a public facing API is required for the client-side executions to function as intended. As the API has routes to high value on-premise services such as MainFrame we need to consider security implications of this carefully.

We need to collaborate closely with the application team to understand fully what security measures can be implemented to protect high value assets.

This piece is to discover, test and implement APIM in front of SPT public APIs to see what common API protections it can offer to improve our security position.
fields.System.History: Still waiting at the moment for the Core Platform team to handover APIM to the DevOps Functions

fields.System.Title: SPT - Retrospective Project Onboard Docs
fields.System.Description: Retrospectively complete the DevOps project onboarding Template for the main cloud infrastructure workloads in SPT. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UCdx9bEgVYQfhA0KpZvmKHFNXvyOcWKQHbJVKpiNWbE/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.6vpmdajmv2y6 We should look to complete the bulk of the known information into here and then look to share with stakeholders to specifically contribute to Functional Requirements, RTO / RPO and other items out of our scope to define

fields.System.Title: Terraform Origin Resource Tags
fields.System.Description:
Capture an idea from a while ago to explore once capacity allows:

It would be good if you could look at a resource in the Azure Portal and have it clear which repo / pipeline put it there.
  • Explore tagging module whether it's possible to bring in values from the build as new tags (repo, pipeline)
fields.System.History: Not sure if the new tagging standards includes this, need to check

fields.System.Title: Terraform Dependency Module
fields.System.Description:
We have Azure infrastructure described in Terraform across multiple projects. Generally there is a pattern of having a configuration per project / workload in addition to 'Shared Infrastructure' where resources utilised by multiple projects are maintained and deployed. This results in a bit of a constant issue with dependency chains, using data sources to refer to components from workload > shared or vice versa.

Tom has implemented some specific examples of this for ADF:
https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-shared-infrastructure?path=/terraform/azure_data_factory.tf&version=GBmain&line=77&lineEnd=134&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=2&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

This concept works but I currently avoid doing similar due to how verbose this solution is. I'd like to come up with something more scalable in a module where I can pass in a list of items in similar way with a named prefix and the suffix determined from the naming module.

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - Event Grid Receiver Function - Test Environment
fields.System.Description:
The Core Platform team will make the batchnotifications Event Grid Topic available in Test in Sprint SPR35.7

https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-shared-infrastructure?path=/terraform/function_apps.tf&version=GBmain&line=112&lineEnd=114&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=37&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-shared-infrastructure?path=/terraform/eventgrid.tf&version=GBmain&line=72&lineEnd=72&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=60&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Ready for Development
fields.System.Title: Storage Account Network Hardening - CustomsTax
fields.System.Description:
Currently a number of storage accounts in the SPT landing zone are publicly accessible with no networking restrictions. With focus on project accounts that may contain valuable datasets.

To line up with the security recommendations from Microsoft, we should look to implement a minimum set of sources permitted to connect to the storage account.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/security-recommendations

Example already implemented for StockPlanning:
https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-stockplanning?path=/terraform/storageaccount.tf&version=GBmain&line=16&lineEnd=28&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

fields.System.Title: Cupid - Landing Zone Networking
fields.System.Description: Depending on the outcome of questions in related task. Cupid vnets may be in scope for migration as it looks like this application has silo'd vnets and is not connected to the landing zone virtual network on it's own subnet.

fields.System.Title: Cupid - Silo'd Virtual Network Migration
fields.System.Description:
Cupid networking exists on silo's vnets that exist in the resource groups with the workloads:



We need to migrate from these networks onto the LandingZone vnets into dedicated subnets as per conversations in Cloud Services chat.

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - Function Invocation Visibility
fields.System.Description:
Issue raised by Abrar that dev team can't see invocations in Production:



Giving WRITE access to the app is probably not recommended as it is an important guardrail to protect the environment. Instead proposed a monitoring solution, could include an App Insights query based visualisation on the Grafana dashboards.

fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Ready for Development
fields.System.Title: Shared Infrastructure - Consolidate Function App Storage Accounts
fields.System.Description:
There's a sprawl of storage accounts in SPT Shared Infrastructure - 4 are used by Function Apps:



(dev pictured)

These CAN be consolidated into a single account and should be to simplify the infrastructure.

Maybe named like this if available:
`lower("func${module.naming.convention["storage_account"]}")`


NOTE:
  • Functions may restart when storage configuration changes
  • Any in-memory state or temporary files will be lost
As a result the development team must be aligned when making the change in any given environment.

fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Ready for Development
fields.System.Title: PricingService - Key Vault Network ACL Review
fields.System.Description:
Noticed that the PricingService Key Vault has a redundant network ACL configured (comments added just now):


The default action is allow, making the rule redundant. Also an uncommented static list is used rather than sourcing values from the 'global config' module.

Review this configuration and see if we are able to implement properly using global config / default deny rule, limiting connections to those from a minimal set of trusted sources.

NOTE: Might form part of wider review across the projects, as I'm keen to ensure that all Key Vaults have suitable and sensible ACLs in place and this is supported from brief interactions with @Poole, Mark from a cloud architecture perspective.

NOTE: The blocker to this is likely to be if application teams are using cloud-hosted ADO agents, as I think some pipelines refer to Key Vaults for secrets.

fields.System.Title: Web Application - Friendly FQDN - PricingService
fields.System.Description:
I recently discovered that the front facing URL being distributed to end users is just the FQDN of the hosting app service.

In some cases these are being distributed externally to third parties, which raises concerns about maintaining professional appearances with partners as the URL doesn't align to the brand and corporate identity.
It also won't have a Next SSL certificate and exposes infrastructure details such as our cloud provider, region etc

fields.System.Title: CommonAuth - AppRole Rollout - CustomsTax
fields.System.Description:
Now that the CommonAuth module has been implemented, we need to roll out the AppRole authentication method to all SPT applications replacing their app-specific roles.

This will ensure that all applications are using a consistent personas for granular levels of access within SPT web applications.

fields.System.Title: Gift Card - Initialise Repo / Terraform Scaffold
fields.System.Description:
Create a new repo from the Terraform template:

https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/Shared.Artifacts/_git/tf-template

using playbook:
https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/Shared.Artifacts/_git/ansible-playbooks?path=/create-terraform-repo


NOTE: Usage guidance is included on the playbook README.

NOTE: Make sure the template has been uplifted first in linked task.

fields.System.Title: Gift Card - Azure Data Factory Provisioning
fields.System.Description:
Provision Azure Data Factory instance to the specification agreed in the scoping meeting:
  • Only include a system assigned ID for ADF
  • The Self hosted Integration Runtime should be linked
  • Role assignments for Devs and ADF to project storage similar to other projects.
  • Grant Gift Card access to the Shared Integration Runtime via shared infrastructure
  • Grant access to the shared Key Vault (ADF System MID)
ILS example:
https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-ImportLogisticsSystem?path=/terraform/data_factory.tf

Shared Integration Runtime permission:
https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-shared-infrastructure?path=/terraform/azure_data_factory.tf

NOTE: We need to ask for the Git integration details required for ADF (project, repo, publish branch)

fields.System.Title: Gift Card - Data Landing Zone Publisher
fields.System.Description:
As part of the Gift Card project the team need to publish a dataset to the 'giftcard' data product to be consumed by external partners.
  • Grant the GiftCard ADF System MID access as a publisher to this container.
Dependent on the ADF existing in a given environment.

fields.System.Description:

fields.System.Title: OTel Monitoring Framework - Azure Container App
fields.System.Description:
The intention is to host the OpenTelemetry Collector on Azure Container Apps

As it's going to be an event driven solution, potentially ingesting a high log rate per second this should scale along with the volume of events being distributed from the Event Hub.

Refine the requirements of this infrastructure component along with solution and cloud architects to gather the information required for a Dev implementation.

Outputs: 
  • Refined task for Dev provisioning
  • Contribute to draft of design docs where needed.

fields.System.Title: OTel Monitoring Framework - Event Hub
fields.System.Description: Event hub is intended to be the point of aggregation for various log sources across the SPT Azure environment.

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - CDN VNET Integration
fields.System.Description:

fields.System.Title: ZEOS - 3PL API Health Monitor
fields.System.Description:
The ZEOS project has a requirement to quickly detect and respond to failures that may occur in the interaction between the ZEOS EventPrc function and the 3PL integration layer.

The application team are creating error level log entries containing the message 'ArticleProcessingError'
  • Create a KQL query to detect log entries
  • Use this query to form a log alert to generate alerts in the SPT - Azure Alerts Google chat space
NOTE: We may also need to direct these events to ServiceNow via the second framework function in the future.

Make sure it aligns to the standard by updating the storage account configuration.

fields.System.Title: Cupid - Enforce Authorization Code Flow
fields.System.Description:
Noticed recently that the main App Registration for the Cupid web app has an expired secret (for 9 months):



However the application is unaffected and was not picked up by the automated process to flag this identity for secret rotation. (I think because the department is missing from the naming convention pre-dating the standard)

Investigate what this service principal is used for, why the expiry hasn't impacted the application and any next steps required either to rotate or remove the secret.

fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Ready for Development
fields.System.Title: Cupid - Terraform Import Service Connection Principal
fields.System.Description:
These service connections exist in SPT.Backlog ADO project:



However they are not maintained in the infrastructure code

  • Include infrastructure code to `main.tf` on the cupid project for these resources
  • Import resources into TFState

fields.System.Title: SPT - PIM Roles for Development Team
fields.System.Description:
A recurring problem for the Stock & Pricing DevOps function is clarity on what levels of access should be given over particular infrastructure components for Development team members working on Azure workloads.

It would be good if we could get to a position that for a particular infrastructure component, it's clearly documented which personas get what roles.

Where a more privileged role is required in higher environments we should look to replace permanent role assignments with eligible PIM roles that can be requested by the team on-demand with justifications for auditing.

https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/pim_eligible_role_assignment

fields.System.Title: Data Landing Zone - Remove All Azure Egress IPs
fields.System.Description: I included all Azure egress IPs on the ADLS storage account ACL, but to achieve the levels of segmentation we're aiming for this needs to be replaced with just the UKsouth ones and all other traffic should be permitted with vnet rules and service endpoints.

fields.System.Title: OTel Monitoring Framework - Repo Documentation
fields.System.Description:
Include a brief overview of the solution on the rsl-observability repo README including links to the design doc and the top level ADO feature etc.

NOTE: Include infrastructure diagram

fields.System.Title: ELS - Include APIM Key in Vault
fields.System.Description: Reach out to Sandeep to check what values need to go in the vault and receive them via secure sharing mechanism.

fields.System.Title: Gift Card - External ADLS Account
fields.System.Description:
The final Data Landing Zone Sub Pub design will include an externally facing ADLS account in addition to the existing internal one.

Whilst this is not yet reflected on the design pattern, it's required to support the Giftcard project.

NOTE: this resource and it's configuration will be another component to import to whatever final solution is designed for the pattern as technical debt in the future.

  • https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-datalanding?path=/terraform/adls.tf - re-factor to 'internal'
  • Include new mapping for external subscribers with SFTP local users with specific access to containers.

SFTP must be enabled for the external account:
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/storage_account.html#sftp_enabled-1

We will need to manage local users as code, mapped to third parties:
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/storage_account_local_user
(which should only have access to the container it's mapped to)

fields.System.Title: PricingService - .NET Stack Upgrade (Prod)
fields.System.Description:
Since the Wholesale release, the application code for Pricing Service is up to .NET 8.

The App won't take advantage of latest performance and security features until the stack on the app service is also upgraded.

https://dev.azure.com/Next-Technology/ic.cloud-core/_git/rsl-pricingservice?path=/terraform/pricingserviceapi.tf&version=GBmain&line=29&lineEnd=29&lineStartColumn=6&lineEndColumn=73&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

(CHG Required)

  • Ask questions about the design pattern from a DevOps perspective for Cloud / Solution Architects to review.
  • Refine user stories from the contents of the design pattern for a Dev implementation for EUDR.

fields.System.Reason: Moved to state Ready for Development
fields.System.Title: Cupid - Easy Auth Implementation - Dev
fields.System.Description:
We learned that the existing implementation of authentication for the Cupid web app is using implicit grant flow, which is strongly advised against by Microsoft:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-oauth2-implicit-grant-flow

The long-term solution is to implement EasyAuth for Cupid which would allow the platform to carry out authentication in a using much more secure method:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/overview-authentication-authorization

fields.System.Title: SPT - PricingService - Virtual Networking Consistency (LZ - Test env)
fields.System.Description:
Currently the new Test env is on the landing zone vnets whereas all the other environments were silo'd virtual networking meaning inconsistency in environment set up 
  • Discovery and stakeholder engagement
  • Runbook for remediation
  • Implementation and coordination with stakeholders

NOTE: As Production is included in the non-compliant environments this work would be a breaking change.

fields.System.Title: Monitoring - SPT Landing Zone Alerts
fields.System.Description:
As it stands today there are very minimal alerts configured for SPT cloud workloads. Configured alerting is developer-lead for project specific scenarios.

As part of the reference architecture we proposed a monitoring baseline which described for a particular resource type, what alert actions should be taken at what thresholds.



This user story is to refine and deliver this monitoring baseline initially for the 3 Tier App Reference architecture scope. (Hopefully Grafana dashboards will be given the go ahead to use to check proposed threshold viability)

High-Level Implementation Plan

Use the existing rsl-alerts repo which provides a framework for alert delivery to Google Chat and ServiceNow channels, to declare Azure Monitor metric alert definitions aligned with the baseline
  • Use https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/data-sources/resources to detect resources of a particular type
  • Use https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/monitor_metric_alert to configure the alert against discovered resources of that type.

fields.System.Title: SPT - Reference Architecture Alignment - Networking - PricingService
fields.System.Description: The project has been assessed against the 3 Tier App Reference Architecture (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NaxEQG6zyes3BJLC-uOxTYOV5RcGxC3hk4wYXpLniUk/edit?usp=sharing). There are outstanding tasks for remediation related to networking for some security improvements.

fields.System.Title: SPT - SQL Database Migration - DEV - PricingService
fields.System.Description: Migration from a silo'd SQL Server to the new shared infrastructure for cost optimisation and security improvements.
fields.System.History: Created this as a duplicate as original needed to be closed off for work completed in SS25, this new US is for remaining work

fields.System.Title: Shared App Configuration - Implementation
fields.System.Description:
Implement Shared App Configuration in Dev environment:

Name: Shared-APPCS-RSL-env-EUW

## Configuration
  • System identity enabled with 'Key Vault Secrets User' role for the Shared Infrastructure Key Vault - Not used for now but would enable in future shared configuration to securely refer to any secrets.
  • Access Keys disabled in all environments - RBAC only via Entra ID
  • Standard SKU

## Configuration Items
  • Create a structure in the infrastructure code for shared configuration values that can be expanded upon easily over time.
  • Include Tenant ID as an example shared value

## Feature Flags
  • `${project)-maintenance-enabled` where ${project} is the key of each SPT Application. To be used to enable maintenance pages for that application
  • `spt-global-maintenance-enabled` to enable maintenance pages redirect for ALL SPT applications.

## Access Control
fields.System.History: Copied from #4472668 as old US needed to be closed off for SS25, remaining wok can be carried out as part of this task linked to AW25
